title: How will having 3 cameras affect smartphone photography? - Quora

response.answer_text: 3 cameras are here already for a while. Android phones have introduced it some 2 years ago. Now a trend to 4 or even more cameras is ongoing.Smartphones cant’t change lenses as real cameras do, so the manufacturers build in more lenses with different field of view (FOV).The 3rd camera is mostly a super wide about 120 degree FOV. This enables you to capture more of the surrounding without the need to move back.The 3rd camera is especially useful in tight spaces or when you can’t move back (like for the busy road or a cliff) but want to see more of the scene.Since the FOV of the 3rd camera is similar to some action cams (GoPro) now a smartphone can generate a similar video footage as action cams.

Well, you have to shoot in DNG to get the most out of any phone sensor. But basically means less stitching in post 360 stree view shots are faster and you don't have to run around as much depending on the configuration.
